data.title: great friendly staff
data.text: my partner and I visited for drinks only. busy bar, staff friendly. good service. good range of beers wines and spirits.

data.title: Great location and that's it.
data.text: Sorry to report this, but I've been their twice during the week and both times really disappointed. Prices are high, service HORRIBLE and food well just typical high priced food!  If your there to drink and drink only might be the place for you, if you want to eat decent food and have a drink of choice, might want to go elsewhere.  Definitely plenty of places in HB.

data.title: Disappointing overall
data.text: Debated "poor" rating but I suppose it's an average sports joint.  Noisy, unenthusiastic service, mediocre beer selection and burgers more like one expects from fast food joints.  Outside seating is pleasant.  Prices are pretty market rate.  It wouldn't take management much to up their game but for now it's junior varsity for Legends Surf City.

data.title: New Main Street location Showcases Sports and Surf Legends
data.text: This new Legends location just opened on Main Street, Huntington Beach, taking the place of the former 3-2-1 restaurant on the corner. A fan of the Long Beach location, I have always liked the sports bar's open, friendly vibe with lots of windows and sports memorabilia.  I love the Surf City display of memorabilia from the International Surfing Museum down the street. Surrounded by dozens of televisions and one gigantic screen often playing pay per view special events, you can probably find a screen to watch whatever your favorite game is. We had dinner on a Friday night, my husband ordering a ABC burger, stacked with avocado, bacon and sautéed onion,  and I tried the chicken pot pie. He loved the burger, but the chicken pot pie, while huge, was disappointing. The recipe used grilled chicken -- probably also used in its salad -- and sour pearl onions. It would have been much better if they used roast chicken. Next time, I'll stick to burgers, and watching the games!

data.title: Fun Sportsbar
data.text:
Great location to spend an evening with friends and catch up on all the games. We went there for drinks after dinner and spend half the night. People from all age groups give it a great mix. 
Nice staff and a good service. Perfect for a fun night out!

data.title: New Hot Spot in Town
data.text: Visited legends Surf City twice since they opened. Once for a group office lunch and once with my wife for drinks and dinner. Professionally run, great service, FASt service, tons of TV Screens everywhere. The bar/restaurant is a Sports Bar with lots of memorabilia through out. Out door seating is available. Located 3 blocks north of PCH on Main Street
